text: Not sure if this is how it works, but it would be great when editing a page if HubSpot let you know as soon as you click into a page if somebody else is editing. I’ve had to re-do changes twice today as I wasn’t aware until I came to save that somebody else was editing.
yes that is how it works, only when saving do you get noticed...unfortunately, great idea
OR the page gets locked and has a little message saying Currently being edited by...
any kind of notification right at the start of editing
Full of these ideas today… Would be great when viewing revised pages if changes where highlighted so we can tell what’s been edited.
This would especially be useful for saved but not published changes

Would love this in Design Tools as well.
The main reason why we build in VS Code locally with a Git repo as a back-up and then add to HS. You can see all the changes: small text edits, added and removed blocks in the code.

Question for you guys on this actually: say we did release this. And say we had an opt in to the feature on the page editor that would link to a global content editor that a marketer could use. When the person in the page editor opts in to global content editing, they're also opting in to the same ability to edit global content from the design manager. So, people in the design manager would then start to see a button linking to a global content editor when they select global groups. Does that....freak you out at all? Or is that ok?
it does freak me out if global groups and global modules are treated the same, and marketers can play with our finely crafted Headers and footers
So global modules, probably ok? But Global groups, definitely not?
